snippet: For two weeks, a family in Park Slope, Brooklyn, has been caring for a black swallowtail butterfly that made its way into their home by hiding in their Christmas tree.
abstract: Family of Brooklyn sixth-grader Skye Rothstein is nurturing black swallowtail butterfly after it was discovered in her bedroom in their Park Slope home in the dead of winter; experts say butterflies have been known to make their way into homes as a wintering chrysalis hidden in a Christmas tree.
lead_paragraph: For two weeks, a family in Park Slope, Brooklyn, has been caring for a black swallowtail butterfly that made its way into their home by hiding in their Christmas tree.

headline.main: An Uninvited Guest, Treated Like a Monarch, Makes Itself at Home
headline.print_headline: An Uninvited Guest, Treated Like a Monarch, Makes Itself at Home
